techmeme.title: Chinese researchers launch Pyramid Flow, an AI model to make a five-second, 384p video in 56 seconds, built using a new technique called pyramidal flow matching (Carl Franzen/VentureBeat)
Google EMEA President Matt Brittin says he plans to step down after a decade in the post and to continue running operations until a successor is chosen (Martin Coulter/Reuters)
Scope3, which makes tools to monitor the carbon footprint of digital ads, raised $25M led by GV to expand into making tools to track the climate impact of AI (Tim De Chant/TechCrunch)
Intel unveils its Arrow Lake desktop processors, with an NPU, better power efficiency at higher clock speeds, and 2X the graphics performance vs. its 14th Gen (Gavin Bonshor/The Register)
Farther, which makes software for financial advisers, raised $72M led by CapitalG and Viewpoint Ventures at a $542M valuation, taking its total funding to $117M (Katie Roof/Bloomberg)
